intro: Galium palustre var. catalaunicum, commonly known as the Catalaunic marsh bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in marshes, fens, and along stream banks. Its presence indicates a stable, undisturbed wetland ecosystem.
